item.title: Almaviva Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Almaviva Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsSeptember 30, 2025Almaviva S.p.A.is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in Almaviva proprietary software solutions such as Joshua CybeRisk Vision, Jiano, Sofia, and Giotto, as well as Almaviva-developed IT solutions.

item.title: CVE Program Operational Update
item.description: CVE Program Operational UpdatenewsSeptember 30, 2025In the event of a potential lapse of federal appropriations, theCommon Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE™) Programwishes to reassure the global cybersecurity community that CVE’s essential functions will continue without interruption.

item.title: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 252 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for October 6, 2025
item.description: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 252 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for October 6, 2025blogBy CVE Program|October 7, 2025

item.title: Early Registration Now Open forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026on April 13-16, 2026!
item.description: Early Registration Now Open forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026on April 13-16, 2026!blogBy CVE Program|October 7, 2025CVE/FIRST VulnCon 2026

item.title: Xona Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Xona Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsOctober 7, 2025Xona Systemsis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for all software produced as part of the Xona Platform including the CSG (Critical System Gateway) and XCM (Xona Central Manager) and vulnerabilities discovered by or reported to Xona Systems for Xona software or its underlying Operating System or Firmware not covered by the scope of another CNA.

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on September 17 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on September 17 Now AvailablenewsOctober 14, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on September 17, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: CVE Podcast — The CVE Consumer Working Group (CWG)
item.description: CVE Podcast — The CVE Consumer Working Group (CWG)podcastOctober 14, 2025“We Speak CVE” podcast host Shannon Sabens chats withCVE Consumer Working Group (CWG)co-chairs, Jay Jacobs and Bob Lord, andCVE™Project Lead Alec Summers, about how the CWG was created to address the needs and perspectives of those who use CVE data — ranging from enterprise security teams to tool developers and managed security service providers — recognizing that their requirements and pain points often differ from those of upstream data providers.

item.title: The Browser Company of New York Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: The Browser Company of New York Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsOctober 14, 2025The Browser Company of New Yorkis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for The Browser Company of New York branded products and technologies only.

item.title: Foxit Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Foxit Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsOctober 14, 2025Foxit Software Incorporatedis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for Foxit issues only.

item.title: CNAs — Register Now for the “CVE Program Technical Workshop 2025” on October 22 & 23, 2025
item.description: CNAs — Register Now for the “CVE Program Technical Workshop 2025” on October 22 & 23, 2025newsOctober 14, 2025The CVE Program will host a virtual “CVE Program Technical Workshop – Autumn 2025” forCVE Numbering Authorities (CNAs)on Wednesday, October 23, 2025, and Thursday, October 24, 2025, from 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. EDT (UTC-4) on both days.This CNA workshop is free, but registration is required. Information on how to register was sent directly to CNAs on October 9, 2025. The registration deadline is 11:59 p.m. EDT (UTC-4) on October 22, 2025, so register today!
